A collider doesn’t need to be exactly the same shape as the object’s mesh - a rough approximation is often more efficient and

indistinguishable in gameplay. More info See in Glossary 2D components. Rigidbody 2D body types Choose which Body Type Defines a fixed behavior for a 2D Rigidbody. Can be Dynamic (the body moves under simulation and is affected by forces like gravity), Kinematic (the body moves under simulation, but and isn’t affected by forces like gravity) or Static (the body doesn’t move under simulation).
